intro: Hymenoxys davidsonii, commonly known as the Davidson's gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine, silky hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Hymenoxys davidsonii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
